results.title: Bert and Barz Down Under (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mark Sanders, Eric Halliday and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Roger Summerhill interviews US comedians Bert and Barz on the subject of producing radio commercials and the use of humour in creating adverts.

results.title: What little girls are made of (TEFC)
results.brief_description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.

results.title: Eager to Write (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, L Reichstein F'tion, Open Channel Productions and W Buckland F'tion
results.brief_description: For children, the process of learning to write is a gradual and experimental one. This program follows the progress of children of different ages in the classroom. Follows a Myer Foundation program at Moonee Ponds West Primary School with Lorraine Wilson.

results.title: The War of words Down Under (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This program looks at the work of BUGAUP and other antismoking campaigns. It discusses the responsibility of the media, tobacco companies and government to public health.

results.title: You'll Be Back
results.brief_description:
Looks at the problems of readjustment that prisoners face on their release from gaol. The dramatisation of particular situations illustrates the type of troubles that may occur and representatives from various organisations, such as Legal Aid, Odyssey House and Personal Emergency Services, advise on how to avoid trouble.

Featuring Gary Sweet as the protagonist, and music by Rose Tattoo.
